page.title: 13FARMING IN FACCOMBE
page.content: All agricultural and grazing land in Faccombe is owned by Faccombe Estates Ltd. The soil is varied with pockets of chalk. There are 24 acres of permanent pasture and 205 acres of ploughed fields which have a 6m strip around the edge which is never fertilised or sprayed. This enables the ground to produce its natural crop alongside the sown crop. Poppies, cowslips, orchids, snowdrops, daffodils, and primroses abound, with butterflies including the small blue. 3000 fattening lambs and 2500 ewes are kept.In 1985 the grass was plentiful but too wet and consequently of poor quality, the animals did not fatten, needing extra feeding. Grain yield was average but high rainfall accompanied by mainly low temperatures and strong winds resulted in the grain starting to grow and be of very poor quality.
